name: Sugar Ridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, let me say that I have never been anywhere that I've felt like the manager of a hotel hired ALL THE RIGHT PEOPLE to be the staff! Every single staff member from the kitchen, waiter, cleaning, drivers, front desk, store, and spa was just overjoyed with the idea of making your every wish a reality. They were sweet, kind, considerate, caring and always went above and beyond to make your vacation the best one yet!
reviews.title: Sweet Sugar Ridge!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apparently, July is the slow season in Antigua and the beginning of the rainy season. It did rain everyday, whether it was for 5 minutes or 50 minutes. Because it rained, it was cloudy most of the day with a few rays of sunshine through the clouds that was more than enough! When I return, I'll try to go at another time in the year to see the difference in weather. My husaband and I traveled for our 5th Anniversary and decided to get a room with a plunge pool. This was a PERFECT idea, especially with the few showers that were around. The pool is about 4ft deep and is just enough space for two to have very romantic days and evenings. We were in it daily and really loved it. The one thing I wish it had was a heater for the night. It would really make the plung pools absolutely perfect!
reviews.title: I didn't stay but......!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were gorgeous and had a very comfortable bed and AMAZING pillows!!! My husband complained our first night back home missing them! LOL! The bathrooms are very simple but beautiful. Pretty tile work all around with a walk in shower. I think that they should add more towels for rooms with the plunge pool.
reviews.title: A very good place with an excellent fine dining restaurant and views to die for

reviews.text: This hotel is on a hill so there is constant walking and climbing of steps everywhere. Personally, I would not send any of my elderly family members there for this reason. There are WONDERFUL drivers (Kevin, Craig & Vorn) who will drive you up and down the hills to get to your room or restaurants. Regardless, you'd have to walk down or up a small flight of steps to get where you want to go. We stayed in room 16 and loved how close it was to the open-air lobby (gorgeous!) and club where the restaurant, spa, gym, and pools were all located. I think I'd definitely request that room again.
reviews.title: An absolute gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants were both delicious but my favorite was the Sugar Ridge Club. The style of food was more appetizing to us and I just found the service there friendlier. That being said, the food service is quicker up at Carmichael's (gorgeous and romantic!). In general, I find the food service to be very slow at this resort however, the wait staff is so friendly and caring that it makes up for it! The breakfast is INCREDIBLE to say the least! I ordered something different every day and loved it more and more!
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Sugar Ridge for a week and had a wonderful time. The décor and amenities were very befitting of a 4-star boutique hotel. We also really liked that it didn’t have the cloistered feel of an all-inclusive where guests never leave the compound. We rented a car to explore on our own but also used the shuttle provided by the resort, because Vaughn, the driver was the kind of guy you wanted to have introduce you around. The restaurants at the hotel are open to the public and it was nice to dine among Antiguans enjoying a special dinner.
reviews.title: A great place for relaxation and access to gorgeous uncrowded beaches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn’t get the all-inclusive plan but did eat at the resort several times for dinner. Carmichael’s featured fabulous food, views, and generally very good service. The Sugar Club was a little more laid back service-wise but the breakfasts were phenomenal. The staff at Sugar Club is still learning the ropes of serving. Once we ordered pancakes only to be told there was no syrup until after the pancakes were delivered to our table. But it is hard to complain when you get a cooked-to-order breakfast included in the price of your room. The pancakes, Dutch pancakes, and French toast were delicious!
reviews.title: On a buys road but still nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn’t go to any of the pools, though they looked lovely, because the beaches nearby were so beautiful we wanted to spend as much time as possible in the ocean. Darkwood and Turner’s Beaches were our favorites for their clear water. The Nest beach (closest to the hotel) had somewhat milky blue water when we were there, but it did have the advantage of Pamela, a massage therapist who sets up a table in a semi-private hut at the end of the beach and gives massages that are half the price of those at the hotel’s Aveda spa (and you get to look out at the gorgeous blue water).
reviews.title: Solid resort with a few quirks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort does have plenty of stairs, and anyone with trouble walking or with small kids may find it frustrating to wait for a cart ride, particularly in the hot sun. However, we were in Room 19 and it was an easy walk down to reception and the Sugar Club.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great service, fantastic views

reviews.text: Those who made our stay more enjoyable: Kerian at the front desk was very helpful in booking a snorkel trip and giving directions to English Harbour. In the Sugar Club, we enjoyed talking with Cleon, one of the servers, and Rose, the manager of the restaurant, who solicited our honest feedback. Craig and Clive were both wonderful for pickups and dropoffs, and Vaughan is an invaluable resource on beaches and all things Antigua. When he dropped us at the beach there was never a question of paying for chair rental; the rule seemed to be that if we bought lunch at the beach the chairs were free.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth in the land of sea and sand :)
New, sophisticated,and charming.
reviews.text: the staff is great, the room new,with a wonderful bathroom,and the swimming pool is a dream that came true.we knew that is not in front of the sea,and it is a problem,but the way in his land Rover was helpful,and he was there for.Very clean,great food.Specially the breakfast.Wow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned home from a two week stay at Sugar Ridge . It was the most wonderful holiday in what we can only describe as paradise. The relaxing atmosphere struck us on arrival after a long flight from Ireland via London. We were driven to our room which was bright and spacious with a huge verandah. Breakfast was fabulous each morning with a variety of dishes which we enjoyed over the two weeks. Pools were immaculate as was the entire hotel. The staff are incredibly efficient with a warm and friendly attitude at all times. Indeed the happy atmosphere which prevails at the hotel can be attributed to the fabulous team spirit of the staff led by manager Keith. While the hotel doesn't have direct access to a beach this was more than compensated for by being driven to a different beach each day by the Shuttle bus driver, Vaughan. A fabulous service! We can't wait to return to Antigua and to Sugar Ridge Hotel.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.text: What a wondeful Hotel with wonderful staff. When we checked in the receptionist Aysha greeted us with a wonderful welcoming caribbean smile. She offered us a cold towel and a cold glass of fruit punch (No rum until your all settled) that what she said, she made us feel welcomed and everytime I passed her at the desk she's always smiling.
reviews.title: Wondeful stay at Sugar Ridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At check in I asked about the room and was told all our room are wonderful and everyone gives you a spectacular view.
reviews.title: so-so

reviews.text: When I entered the room and saw the view she knew what she was talking about
reviews.title: Lovely hotel no atmosphere no staff small pools

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancee and I stayed at Sugar Ridge for five nights last week, accomponied by several friends. The resort is beautiful, with stylish, modern decor, gorgeous rooms and very comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort - Dissapointing Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I read previous reviews that said service needed work, I assumed it was waitors or cleaning staff who weren't quite accustomed to their positions yet. Instead, staff was slow, inattentive and just plain rude in some interactions. Slow service really isn't too much of a bother when you are on vacation, however, waiting an hour to receive your drinks in not acceptable. One evening we brought our own bottle of champagne (given to our friends by the resort after they got engaged) and after the waitress took it to "chill for a few moments" we didn't see it again until our meal was served almost an hour and a half later. When we asked about it multiple times, we were told that it wasn't ready. This was our last night at the resort and it didn't leave a great last impression. Our friends, who stayed at another resort in Antigua before Sugar Ridge, said that service quality was far below what they experienced at their previous resort.
reviews.title: beautiful views

reviews.text: We did have several waiters who were friendly and efficient, and the woman who works the front desk in the morning is kind and helpful. Cleaning staff was also very friendly and stopped by the rooms twice a day. We rented a car (which I would recommed) so I didn't interact with Vaughn or experience the shuttle service.
reviews.title: Stunning new hotel in Antigua - Sugar Ridge rocks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sugar Ridge offers an All-Inclusive option which I would strongly discourage you from using. We did it for part of our stay and it was hard to eat and drink our way through $90 per person in one day (breakfast is included in the non-inclusive option). Also, when we went to Carmichael's for dinner, the All Inclusive options were severely restricted, something that was not mentioned in the menu we were shown at the front desk. We found this pretty infuriating and somewhat deceitful. No one likes to feel nickeled and dimed at a high class resort.
reviews.title: Friendly & Chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, Sugar Ridge is gorgeous and was the nicest looking hotel we saw. The pools were great, and the beaches near the hotel were spactacular. I would return, but hope that management gets their act together and service improves. It definitely has potential!
reviews.title: Just Beautiful - Travel Agent Review

description: Sugar Ridge is Antigua’s most anticipated resort, opened in December 2009. Perched upon its namesake hillside bordered with sugar cane and lush flora and fauna, the resort features 60 rooms that wrap around the property, featuring panoramic views to the south and west of palm-lined beaches and the turquoise Caribbean Sea, plus the neighboring islands of Redonda, St. Kitts and Nevis. Sugar Ridge entertains guests with three swimming pools, the island’s first-ever Aveda Concept Spa.
